summary: A letter from an attorney to an Assistant US Attorney regarding a client who was subpoenaed to appear before a grand jury investigating Jeffrey Epstein. The attorney asserts the client's Fifth Amendment rights and requests a formal grant of use immunity for the client to testify.

persons.name: Assistant US Attorney
persons.context: The recipient of the letter, based in West Palm Beach, FL, who is conducting an investigation related to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'Mr. Epstein', the subject of a police and federal investigation. The letter mentions that the client is no longer employed by him.

connections.description: The client was formerly employed by Jeffrey Epstein, as stated in the letter.
The author of the letter is representing the client in response to a grand jury subpoena.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: The client was subpoenaed to appear before a grand jury on this date, but the appearance was extended on consent.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: A grand jury subpoena was issued for the client to appear.

locations: 500 South Australian Ave Ste 400, West Palm Beach, FL
keyFacts: An attorney is asserting a former Epstein employee's Fifth Amendment rights in response to a federal grand jury subpoena.
The client is aware that police considered charging several persons close to Epstein, including at least one employee.
The attorney states that both state authorities in Palm Beach County and the federal office are conducting investigations into Epstein.
The attorney requests a formal grant of use immunity for the client to testify before the grand jury.
